title: Exam Study Schedule Generator
goal: Plan exam preparation with clear topic timelines.
prompt: You are a {subject} teacher. Create a schedule {subject} exam covering {number_of_topics}. For each schedule include: ‚Ä¢ Topic ‚Ä¢ Date ‚Ä¢ Duration ‚Ä¢ Revision focus

responses.gpt-5:
Here‚Äôs a well-structured **Mathematics Exam Schedule** covering 10 topics with dates, durations, and revision focus:

---

### **Mathematics Exam Schedule**

| No. | Topic                          | Date        | Duration | Revision Focus                                                       |
| --- | ------------------------------ | ----------- | -------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 1   | Algebra ‚Äì Linear Equations     | 01-Dec-2025 | 1.5 hrs  | Solving linear equations, word problems, and inequalities            |
| 2   | Algebra ‚Äì Quadratic Equations  | 02-Dec-2025 | 1.5 hrs  | Factorization, quadratic formula, discriminant, and roots            |
| 3   | Geometry ‚Äì Triangles & Circles | 03-Dec-2025 | 2 hrs    | Properties of triangles, circle theorems, and constructions          |
| 4   | Coordinate Geometry            | 04-Dec-2025 | 1.5 hrs  | Distance, midpoint, slope, equation of line, and intersection points |
| 5   | Trigonometry                   | 05-Dec-2025 | 1.5 hrs  | Trig ratios, identities, solving triangles, and applications         |
| 6   | Calculus ‚Äì Differentiation     | 06-Dec-2025 | 2 hrs    | Derivatives, rules, maxima & minima, and rate of change              |
| 7   | Calculus ‚Äì Integration         | 07-Dec-2025 | 2 hrs    | Indefinite & definite integrals, area under curve, and applications  |
| 8   | Probability & Statistics       | 08-Dec-2025 | 1.5 hrs  | Mean, median, mode, variance, probability rules, and distributions   |
| 9   | Matrices & Determinants        | 09-Dec-2025 | 1.5 hrs  | Matrix operations, inverse, determinant properties, and applications |
| 10  | Vectors & 3D Geometry          | 10-Dec-2025 | 2 hrs    | Vector addition, dot & cross product, lines & planes in space        |

---

‚úÖ **Tips for Students Before Each Exam:**

* Spend 1‚Äì2 hours the previous day focusing on formulas, key concepts, and problem-solving shortcuts.
* Solve at least 3‚Äì5 previous year questions per topic.
* Time yourself during practice to manage the actual exam duration effectively.

---

Optionally, a visually appealing calendar-style timetable can be generated for easier tracking.
responses.gemini-2.5:
Here's a proposed 10-topic mathematics exam schedule, focusing on high school level topics:

## üìÖ Mathematics Exam Schedule

| # | Topic | Date | Duration | Revision Focus |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| 1 | Algebraic Expressions & Polynomials | Dec 1 | 60 mins | Factoring techniques, exponent laws, and polynomial long division. |
| 2 | Linear Equations & Inequalities | Dec 3 | 45 mins | Solving single and multi-variable equations; graphing inequalities. |
| 3 | Quadratic Equations | Dec 5 | 75 mins | Solving by factoring, completing the square, quadratic formula; discriminant. |
| 4 | Functions | Dec 8 | 60 mins | Domain and range, function notation, composite and inverse functions. |
| 5 | Trigonometry (Basic) | Dec 10 | 75 mins | SOH CAH TOA, unit circle, special triangles, basic identities. |
| 6 | Coordinate Geometry | Dec 12 | 60 mins | Distance, midpoint, slope, equations of lines. |
| 7 | Geometry (Area & Volume) | Dec 15 | 90 mins | Calculating area, perimeter, surface area, volume of solids. |
| 8 | Sequences and Series | Dec 17 | 60 mins | Arithmetic and geometric sequences/series; n-th term and sum formulas. |
| 9 | Logarithms and Exponentials | Dec 19 | 75 mins | Log laws, solving equations, change of base formula. |
| 10 | Probability and Statistics | Dec 22 | 90 mins | Counting principles, permutations, combinations, mean, median, mode, SD. |

### üìù Note to Students
Focus on **practice problems** over passive reading. Understand *why* methods work, not just *how*.
responses.claude-3:
# Mathematics Exam Schedule

## Exam 1: Algebra Fundamentals
**Date:** Monday, December 2, 2025  
**Duration:** 1.5 hours  
**Revision Focus:** Linear equations, polynomial operations, factoring, solving quadratic equations, and graphing linear functions.

---

## Exam 2: Functions and Graphing
**Date:** Wednesday, December 9, 2025  
**Duration:** 1.5 hours  
**Revision Focus:** Function notation, domain and range, transformations of functions, inverse and composite functions.

---

## Exam 3: Sequences and Series
**Date:** Friday, December 16, 2025  
**Duration:** 1.5 hours  
**Revision Focus:** Arithmetic/geometric sequences, general terms, sum formulas, explicit and recursive forms.

---

## Exam 4: Trigonometry Basics
**Date:** Monday, December 30, 2025  
**Duration:** 2 hours  
**Revision Focus:** Unit circle, sine, cosine, tangent ratios, special angles, trig identities, solving trig equations.

---

## Exam 5: Exponential and Logarithmic Functions
**Date:** Wednesday, January 13, 2026  
**Duration:** 1.5 hours  
**Revision Focus:** Properties of exponents, exponential growth/decay, logarithmic functions, solving equations, real-world applications.

---

## Exam 6: Complex Numbers
**Date:** Friday, January 20, 2026  
**Duration:** 1.5 hours  
**Revision Focus:** Imaginary units, operations, modulus, argument, De Moivre's theorem, polar form.

---

## Exam 7: Vectors and Matrices
**Date:** Monday, January 27, 2026  
**Duration:** 2 hours  
**Revision Focus:** Vector operations, dot/cross products, matrix operations, determinants, solving systems using matrices.

---

## Exam 8: Calculus - Limits and Derivatives
**Date:** Wednesday, February 3, 2026  
**Duration:** 2 hours  
**Revision Focus:** Limits, continuity, derivative rules, optimization, motion problems, curve sketching.

---

## Exam 9: Calculus - Integration
**Date:** Friday, February 10, 2026  
**Duration:** 2 hours  
**Revision Focus:** Antiderivatives, indefinite/definite integrals, fundamental theorem, substitution/integration by parts, area and volume applications.

---

## Exam 10: Probability and Statistics
**Date:** Monday, February 17, 2026  
**Duration:** 1.5 hours  
**Revision Focus:** Probability theory, permutations/combinations, distributions, expected value, variance, hypothesis testing, data analysis.
